positions.rationale: Monster earnings beat being ignored — reversion opportunity. Q4 EPS $3.81 vs $3.05 expected (+25%), fastest revenue growth in 2 years (+12% YoY), $50B buyback announced, Agentforce at $800M ARR with 29,000 deals. Stock was -28% YTD pre-earnings despite best print in enterprise software history. Market overly punishing AI disruption fears — a $50B buyback at these prices is enormous. Coiled spring setup.

score.notes: Exceptional catalyst and buyback support, but R:R of 1.35:1 is below the 2:1 minimum — stop at $185 is too wide relative to the $212 target. Technical setup is a recovery, not a clean breakout.

thesisKillers: Wave of enterprise customers announcing significant headcount reductions (per-seat revenue directly impacted)
Agentforce ARR growth stalls — next quarter below $1B signals AI narrative not converting to revenue
Macro shock or sector-wide SaaS multiple compression driven by rising rates or risk-off rotation
positions.reviewNotes: 26/02 AH: Block fires 4,000 people — per-seat risk activated. CRM dropped to $190 in thin AH tape. Thesis weakened but not broken (one customer, $50B buyback still a floor). Risk level raised to 2. Watch pre-market open — if below $188 on volume, reassess. Watch for other enterprise tech companies announcing layoffs in next 48hrs.

positions.rationale: Fresh earnings beat + defensive rotation tailwind. EPS $2.38 vs $2.27, revenue +7% to $2.34B, FCF $487M vs $151M YoY. Coffee segment (Folgers, Café Bustelo, Dunkin') up 23%. Stock-specific move — peers MKC, HRL, CPB all down on the same day. Elliott Management activist pressure adding catalyst. Broke above $109–111 resistance on heavy volume. Day 1 of post-earnings move, not a chase.

score.notes: Strong setup on 3 of 4 dimensions but R:R of 0.62:1 is structurally dangerous — stop at $107.50 is $8.33 away while target is only $5.18 away. Either the target needs to be raised to $125+ or the stop needs to be tightened to $112 to make the R:R acceptable. Holding given strong catalyst but this is a framework violation.

thesisKillers: Earnings revision downward — if restatement or guidance cut emerges in the following weeks
Consumer staples sector selloff driven by macro data (e.g., strong CPI reducing defensive rotation)
Elliott Management exits activist position or reduces stake — removes the upward pressure catalyst
positions.reviewNotes: 26/02 Entry: Thesis intact. Clean technical breakout on volume, stock-specific move. Main concern is R:R — structurally below minimum. Monitoring for any weakening in post-earnings momentum. If price stalls at $118 for 2 days without progress toward $121, time-stop applies.

positions.rationale: Deeply oversold mean-reversion with near-term catalysts. Down ~37% over past year, trading at just 8x forward earnings. Bloomberg reported Stripe acquisition rumours. New CEO Enrique Lores starts March 1. Potential double-bottom forming, RSI severely oversold. Analyst consensus target $64 (+36% upside). High-risk speculative position — entered only after stock held above $44 confirmation level.

score.notes: Excellent R:R of 3.33:1 justifies speculative position. Catalyst is rumour-driven (Stripe deal unconfirmed) and CEO transition is a known-unknown. Downtrend still intact structurally. Just passes the 13/20 entry threshold. CEO transition on March 1 is a binary event — watch closely.

thesisKillers: Stripe acquisition rumour definitively denied by either party — removes the M&A premium
New CEO March 1 disappoints on first communication — no new strategy or cuts guidance
Broader fintech selloff if interest rate expectations shift hawkish
positions.reviewNotes: 26/02 Entry: Thesis intact. Position entered after $44 hold confirmed. Binary event on March 1 (CEO transition) — will reassess thesis immediately after. R:R is best of the three current positions at 3.33:1. Monitor Stripe news closely.
